byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: An agreement with lawmakers would give the president “fast track” authority to negotiate the Trans-Pacific Partnership but could push final consideration to his successor.

headline.print_headline: Deal on Trade Pact Gives Obama Authority but Builds In a Delay
headline.main: Deal on Trade Pact Gives Obama Authority but Builds In a Delay

snippet: An agreement with lawmakers would give the president “fast track” authority to negotiate the Trans-Pacific Partnership but could push final consideration to his successor.
abstract: Republican lawmakers, seeking to grant Pres Obama 'fast track' authority to negotiate Trans-Pacific Partnership, agree to subject any trade deal to monthslong review by Congress and public; move is seen as concession to Democrats who view pact as threat to American jobs; shift might push final decision on deal to Obama's successor.
